definitions: Any of a series of salts, typically purple or red, of an anion (C₈ H₄ N₅ O₆)−, which contains two heteroaromatic rings.

etymologies: late Middle English (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin purpurātus dressed in purple, in post-classical Latin also born in the purple, illustrious, blood-stained, designating or relating to the disease purpura from purpura purple dye, purple garment + -ātus. Compare Spanish purpurado, Portuguese purpurado, Italian porporato

definitions: Of language or rhetoric: rich; elaborate, ornate. Compare "purple".
